subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanji|grade=6|rs=貝05}}

# [[expensive]] ([[たかい]])
# [[worthful]], [[precious]] (たかい, [[とうとい]], [[たっとい]])
# [[superior]], [[aristocratic]] (たかい, とうとい, たっとい, [[えらい]], [[あてやか]])
# to [[esteem]] ([[とうとぶ]], [[たっとぶ]])

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|き}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=き}} {{m|zh|貴|tr=kjwɨj<sup>H</sup>|lit=precious, noble, superior}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=goon|き}}

subSections.title: Prefix
Derived terms
Suffix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|suffix|き}}

# added after nouns related to people to express love and respect

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: This suffix meaning appears from roughly the {{w|Edo period}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あて}}

Unknown. Possibly cognate with {{m|ja|当て|tr=ate||aim; expectation, hope}}, the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|当てる|tr=ateru||to face one thing towards another; to make something hit a target}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|あて}}

subSections.title: Adjective
Noun
Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|貴人|あてびと}}: an [[aristocrat]]; a [[nobleman]]; a person with a [[noble]] and [[refined]] [[bearing]]
* {{ja-r|貴ぶ|あてぶ}}: to be [[refined]] and [[elegant]]
* {{ja-r|貴ばむ|あてばむ}}: to appear [[refined]] and [[elegant]]
* {{ja-r|貴はか|あてはか}}: [[refined]], [[elegant]]
* {{ja-r|貴やか|あてやか}}: [[refined]], [[elegant]]
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|むち}}

Possibly a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=むち|身|tr1=mu|t1=body|霊|tr2=chi|t2=spirit, essence, soul}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Alternatively, may be an alteration of {{m|ja|睦|tr=mutsu||friendly, harmonious|pos=affix not used in isolation}},<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> probably caused by fusion with the {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=むち|-}} emphatic nominal particle {{m|ja|い|tr=i}} in a manner similar to the alteration between ''kamu'' (combining form) and ''kami'' (standalone form) for {{m|ja|神||god, spirit}}, or ''kutsu'' (combining form) and ''kuchi'' (standalone form) for {{m|ja|口||mouth}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|むち}}

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Etymology 4
subSections.text:
Used as [[ateji]] in various names.

{{der-top|Names}}
